card.note: One of my favorite things about you is how caring and sentimental you are. I'm touched when I see your eyes get misty because you have been affected by a situation, something someone said, or even one of your wonderful jazz standards. Joseph gets this trait from you....
card.author: Jackie Aguanno

card.note: My Uncle Joe is one of a kind. I never heard him angry, always there when you needed him; and what I remember very clearly, is how he always pampered my Aunt Gil and still does. As I said above, he is "ONE OF A KIND." Love you Uncle Joe.
card.author: Marilyn Marino

card.note: What a special man, my brother is. Always even-tempered and always fun to be with. We've had many good times together and never a harsh word between us. I love him with all my heart. Joe, may you have health and happiness today on your birthday and always. /RFran & John

Somehow related by marriage, but definitely bonded by LOVE! Plain and simple, I LOVE THIS MAN! Special in so many ways! Loyal, sensitive, loving, and thoughtful, add in a strong social conscience and and there you have "Big Joe"!
card.author: Rose Istrico

card.note: Uncle Joe was always my favorite. He was special, he bowled, played stick ball and was a pro at horseshoes. I will always cherish our visits to Arrowhead Lake and Mays Landing. He will always be a "ten" in my eyes.
card.author: Artie

card.note: Big Joe, you truly are a gift to our great nation; being born on the fourth of July was clearly no coincidence. May this be a very happy birthday and your best one yet! Happy birthday and much love!
card.author: Anthony, a.k.a. The Scarf

card.note: Dear Uncle Joe, What an honor to have fireworks displayed across the nation in celebration of your birth. Cheers to you! Lots of love.
card.author: Heather Istrico (inherited niece)

card.note: Dear Uncle Joe,/RJust wanted you to know just how special you are. I have some wonderful memories of you and Aunt Gil as I was growing up. I couldn't ask for a better Godfather. You are loved more than you'll ever know. Thank you for being you. XoXoXo
card.author: Debbie, Frank, Corey, Ryan & Jesse

card.note: Memories from the cross country trip Dad and me took in September 1982. Five days from Laguna Beach to Staten Island!
card.author: Charles

card.note: The trips to Brockport each August with Mom and Dad to take me to college. One trip especially in my memory was the side trip we took to Niagara Falls. Another memory is Dad getting a speeding ticket in Horseheads, NY.
card.author: Charles

card.note: Dad's joy in beating Aunt Fran and Annette in family Jeopardy during the Thanksgiving trip to Aunt Fran's and Uncle Johnny's in Ocean Pines in 2012.
card.author: Charles

card.note: The move to the Atria in January 2015
card.author: Charles

card.note: Always be there for all of us whenever we needed him! His great sense of humor too.
card.author: Charles

card.note: HI JOE/R WE WERE PLAYING A ROUND AT GREEN TREE. I RECALLED YOUR WORST TEE SHOT EVER. WE WERE ON THE SECOND TEE BOX, YOU HIT A LOW LINE DRIVE. THE BALL HIT A RAILROAD TIE ALONG THE CART PATH, AND BOUNCED STRAIGHT BACK ABOUT FIFTY YARDS./R HAPPY BIRTHDAY
card.author: JOYCE & CHARLIE

card.note: One of our fondest memories is the trip my son’s home in North Carolina with Joe, where we went to the Master’s. We had a great time!/R/R
card.author: Vince and Jean Ciarrocchi

card.note: We also enjoy going to dinner with Joe and Gilda and recall the bottle of wine Joe brought with him to dinner and re-cork, after pouring himself a glass – and saved until the next time we went to dinner.
card.author: Vince and Jean Ciarrocchi

card.note: We often wondered if it was a particularly good bottle of wine, but we never were offered a taste!/R/RJoe, may that bottle of wine last until you’re 105! We hope we get to enjoy dinner with you again (before then), even if we don’t share your wine…/R/R
card.author: Vince and Jean Ciarrocchi

card.note: Thank you for saving my life when I passed out in the bathroom!/R/RTom and I always enjoyed having lunch with you and Gilda on Mondays at Peter's Diner in Turnersville. /R/RHappy birthday!/R
card.author: Barbara from across the street

card.note: You have been a constant presence in my life since I was born. I love you and always think of you on the 4th of July. I love your caring and encouragement and your sense of humor. Happiest of Birthdays to you!/R
card.author: Annette Arena & Jack Belgum

card.note: To my Uncle Joe,/RSince I was a kid I always looked up to you but not until I was an adult did I truly value every moment we spend together, every conversation, every I love you before we hang up the phone. I'm so lucky to have you in my life! Happy Birthday. I love you!
card.author: Your Niece, Denise XO

card.note: The way you stick your tongue out to one side when you're thinking of something clever to say. Which, by the way, is always funny.
card.author: Love, Denise

card.note: I can never forget your birthday. Born on the 4th of July...and I follow 2 days later on July 6. I always feel like we have a special little birthday bond XOXO
card.author: Love, Denise

card.note: Dear Joe, /RHAPPY BIRTHDAY!/RYou are a loving husband and father. You have raised a beautiful family to be proud of. We celebrate YOU, dear Joe. You are very special!/RHealth, Happiness, Love always,/Rxoxoxo
card.author: Mayra and Art Baskin

card.note: HAPPY BIRTHDAY MY FRIEND!/RYOU ARE SO MISSED! WISH WE COULD MEET AT MILL ST./RHAPPY BIRTHDAY MY FRIEND!/R
card.author: Love, Bob and Hope Knight

card.note: We know you moved up to the Bronx, because you couldn't find Eggplant Parmesan like your mother made. We hope Arthur Ave. has satisfied your long quest. /RDon't set new scoring records at Winged Foot!/R/RFriends forever. We love and miss you. Have a great one.
card.author: Kathy and Bob Goodman

card.note: I remember the time we all went golfing Joe hit his ball into a Green Side Bunker. I'm watching him trying to hit out - 1 swing, 2 swings.... After about 5 swings Joe picks it up and throws it out! Joe what did you get on that hole-3? LOL gotta love him! And we do!!
card.author: Jim & Ellie

card.note: When it comes to finance, no one does it better than Joe Aguanno :-) /R
card.author: Gertrude Jones

card.note: Joe's best quality is the love he has for his wife.
card.author: Gertrude Jones

card.note: Joe, you finally done it. You left us for the "muckity muck" of New York. You Ranger fans are all the same. /RHappy BirthDay
card.author: Gil & Trudy

card.note: Now that we are at the pool, I really miss you stopping by for a visit. Hope everything is good with both of you. Miss you both./R
card.author: Ellie xxoo

card.note: Famous quotes.."Nobody remembers Big Joe'' (not true of course), "I'll buy again'' (always true). I very much miss "Hello, old, old, old pal, need something?" Just remember who got the prune juice in Syracuse!
card.author: Frank & Ann

card.note: We miss you & Gil a lot! Hope to see you soon./R/RHappy birthday!
card.author: Frank & Ann

card.note: The way you fist pump every time you are 'right' (I can imagine it in my head right now!). Love you XO
card.author: Love, Denise

card.note: "I have ties older than you" (to my new boyfriend)
card.author: Love you, Denise XO

card.note: Dad..you always make friends with everyone around you
card.author: Ann

card.note: Thanks for teaching me how to ride a bicycle...
card.author: Ann

card.note: Happy birthday to a great guy and good friend. I miss spending time with you - whether on the golf course, the pool, Phillies games, and our dinners. You have a great sense of humor and always tell it like it is./RBest wishes and good health to both you and Gilda.
card.author: Your friends Jim and Peg

card.note: I still golf, but don't enjoy it as much as when we had our group from the Oaks. We had a good camaraderie. I forgive you for running into me with the golf cart and I still say the best beer I ever had was the $4 Yuengling you bought for me at Frog Rock.
card.author: Your friends Jim and Peg

card.note: I couldn't choose my father, but if I could I would have chosen you./R/RHappy birthday. Stick around for many more./R/RLove - Joe Jr.
card.author: Joseph Aguanno

card.note: Uncle Joe-I think you know how much I love you. One of my favorite memories is on Thanksgiving a few yrs ago when we played Family Jeopardy. Just having all of us together & seeing you happy made me happy. In the end, that is what it is all about. Love & Family. xox
card.author: Dianne, Steve, Matt & Chris

card.note: I forgot to add Happy Birthday!!!/R/RLove you!
card.author: Dianne

card.note: Have to add this one..when you came to my house on LI for my Mom's 49th B-Day, after you entered you said it took you so long to get there that you had to adjust your watch for the time zone and then you said you had to leave so you could make to to work in Monday! LOL
card.author: Dianne

card.note: I love your love of SocialTea cookies! Nana always used to hide them in our food pantry so that she would have them on hand when you came to visit. Whenever I see those cookies, I always think of you and those visits. xox
card.author: Dianne

card.note: So, this Flatterbox is another thing I did on the computer. Aren't you glad you didn't take it away from me? /R/RIf I could have chosen a father, you would have been at the top of my list! You're a 15!/R/RHappy birthday and much love,
card.author: Jackie

card.note: So, this Flatterbox is another thing I did on the computer. Aren't you glad you didn't take it away from me? /R/RIf I could have chosen a father, you would have been at the top of my list! You're a 15!/R/RHappy birthday and much love,/R
card.author: Jackie
